executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Revenue for playground designers in the United States has been volatile during the current period because of COVID-19 and shifts in interest rates. During the pandemic, supply chain disruptions made it more difficult for designers to get the equipment they needed, while fear of the virus significantly reduced attendance in parks and recreation centers, constraining spending from this market. Despite these challenges, record-low interest rates made it easier for households to borrow money to make backyard playgrounds, so demand from homeowners caused revenue to soar in 2020. When the recovery took hold, playground equipment became more readily available and mass vaccination caused people to go back to parks and recreation centers, spurring investment in playground design services. The industry also benefited from growing school funding as the government pushed money into K-12 education as a response to the disruptions related to the pandemic. Rising interest rates have recently hindered demand from homeowners and have made equipment prices more expensive, hindering demand for designers. Overall, revenue for playground designers in the United States is expected to soar at a CAGR of 5.5% during the current period, reaching $80.3 million in 2024. This includes a 0.2% drop in that year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Soaring demand from households kept revenue alive during COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the pandemic hit, state and local governments enforced social distancing measures. It became harder for playground equipment manufacturers to build their merchandise while operating under these rules, disrupting the industry's supply chain. The virus also made people more afraid to go to parks and recreation centers, constraining demand from a major buyer of the industry's services. Despite these challenges, record-low interest rates caused by the Federal Reserve's quantitative easing made it very inexpensive for households to borrow money for home improvements. As homeowners upgraded their properties, they spent significantly more on playground design services, causing revenue to soar in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The recovery boosted spending from various markets
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As social distancing measures were relaxed, playground equipment manufacturers were able to operate their equipment more efficiently, boosting production. Higher production increased demand for playground construction since equipment was more readily available, which spurred investment in the industry's services. Demand from schools was strong as legislation such as the American Rescue Plan (ARP) provided hundreds of billions of dollars for K-12 institutions as a response to COVID-19. High government subsidies encouraged schools to invest in playgrounds, increasing the need for designers. Mass vaccination made it more safe for people to go to parks and recreation centers, so attendance at these places soared. Playground construction grew at parks and recreation centers in response to rising downstream demand, boosting investment in the industry's services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising interest rates have ground revenue to a halt
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As inflation has soared, the Federal Reserve has been raising interest rates to bring prices down. Since some homeowners borrow money to construct playgrounds, higher interest rates have constrained demand for the industry's services from households, hindering revenue. The elevated cost of borrowing has also made it more difficult for playground equipment manufacturers to expand their operations. Prices for playground equipment have risen as a result, inhibiting demand for playgrounds and their

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Steady income growth will spur demand for designers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite current challenges related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, US GDP is expected to grow steadily during the outlook period. High GDP growth will spur demand for retail trade, manufacturing, wholesaling and other sectors. As revenue soars for many businesses, corporate profit will rise, causing many companies to raise their employees' wages. Per capita disposable income will rise as a result. High disposable income will encourage households to build playgrounds themselves or attend parks and recreation centers more often, increasing investment in playgrounds and boosting demand for the industry's services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The level of investment from schools will be shaky
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While federal, state and local government budgets will be burdened by retirement and healthcare obligations, public demand for investment in schools will keep funding for K-12 education high. This will give schools the funds to invest in more playgrounds and pay more designers. Despite these developments, investment in the industry's services will be rocked by low school enrollment. As birth rates fall, the number of K-12 students will decline so that playground usage drops, encouraging some schools to cut investment in them despite higher school funding. The drop in downstream demand from schools will hinder revenue growth during the outlook period.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry design outdoor playgrounds for children. Products offered include backyard playgrounds along with sports and fitness, sensory play, climbing, general playground and other equipment. They serve homeowners, not-for-profit organizations, schools and parks and recreation centers.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Government funding for primary and secondary education

key_trends: Revenue growth has been quite volatile during the current period.
Strong demand for playground construction during the pandemic recovery aided the industry while soaring interest rates have inhibited designers' performance.
The industry will grow slowly during the outlook period. Designers will benefit from steady economic growth but will be negatively affected by declining school enrollment.
Regulation for playground design companies is relatively low because the industry doesn't manage financial products or hazardous materials. Companies are subject to regulations pertaining
One major organization supporting playground design service companies is the National Playground Contractors Association (NPCAI)

Sensory play equipment is brought to playgrounds to stimulate kids' minds while climbing structures are used to build their muscles. Other playground equipment includes balance bars and crawl tunnels.

Most playgrounds are in public spaces, so most of the industry's revenue comes from parks, recreation centers and schools. Some homeowners pay designers to build playgrounds for their children, but this is fairly uncommon.

Barriers to entry are low because of nonexistent licensing requirements and minimal start-up costs. No licenses are necessary, but receiving a certification from a relevant association boosts a designer's reputation.

Low market share concentration helps parks, households and schools compete on price for playground designers, giving them buyer power. A strong distribution network enhances supplier power for playground equipment manufacturers.

Market share concentration is low because of localization. Small playground designers have built a solid reputation within their specific community, making it difficult for larger players to gobble up more of the industry.
There are a handful of substitutes for playground design services. These include in-house services, landscape architects, child development specialists and graphic designers.
Profit has held steady during the current period despite soaring revenue. Intense internal competition has caused designers to undercut each other.
Wages make up a large share of revenue because the industry is labor-intensive. Compensation's revenue share has crept downward during the current period as revenue has grown more quickly than wages.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Older children spend nearly seven hours per weekday in school, so going to class is a significant portion of their lives. Schools give children about an hour to eat lunch and play in the schoolyard daily. Kids enjoy playing on climbing structures, ladders, crawl tunnels and other playground equipment, so demand for playground designing services from schools is high. Concerns related to childhood development and kids' mental health have caused government funding for primary and secondary education to expand, so schools' revenue share has grown during the current period.

Families go to parks and recreation centers to meet with extended family members or friends. Since these families tend to include lots of young children, parks and recreation centers have lots of playgrounds, making them comprise more than a third of revenue. COVID-19 caused a major drop in park and recreation center attendance, as families were afraid to meet up in large groups. Attendance still hasn't recovered from the pandemic, causing parks and recreation centers' revenue share to creep downward during the current period.

Some homeowners ask playground designers to build playgrounds in their backyards for their kids. The families that can afford these services are primarily upper-middle and upper-class, so households only make up a bit more than one-tenth of revenue. Designs tend to be smaller and more personalized, so they require more attention to detail. Rising interest rates have made it harder for homeowners to afford internal improvements, so households' revenue share has fallen during the current period.

Some not-for-profit organizations own recreation centers, parks and other buildings that include playgrounds, so they make up a small but notable share of revenue. The success of non-profit organizations is dependent on the level of donations from rich individuals. The number and value of donations have soared recently as stock prices have spiked, causing not-for-profit groups to invest in playgrounds and boosting this segment's revenue share during the current period.

products_and_services.product_description: General playground equipment includes 90-degree, crawl, facet crawl, log crawl and wiggle worm crawl tunnels, while other equipment includes crazy domes and infant balance bars. These types of equipment help infants and young children stimulate their minds, so they're built in schools (for kindergarteners), day care centers and parks.

Sensory play equipment includes talk tubes, paint panels, sand tables, sandboxes and splash circuits. Children use sensory and play equipment to help them communicate and collaborate more effectively and be more creative. This improves their emotional intelligence long-term. Americans have become more sedentary, so they've been using sensory play equipment much less frequently, causing this segment's revenue share to fall during the current period.

Sports and fitness playground equipment includes roller tables. Children use roller tables and other forms of sports and fitness equipment to exercise, boosting their physical well-being. Americans have become more sedentary, so they've been using sports and fitness equipment much less frequently, causing this segment's revenue share to fall during the current period.

While most playgrounds are built in schools, parks and recreation centers, some families pay designers to build playgrounds in their backyards. These households tend to be quite wealthy since they have the disposable income to build their own playgrounds. These playgrounds tend to be smaller and more personalized, tending to the needs of each specific family. Swing sets, monkey bars and climbing sets used by only a few children are popular parts of backyard playgrounds. Rising interest rates have made it harder for families to engage in home improvements, causing backyard playgrounds' revenue share to creep downward during the current period.

Climbing structures built in playgrounds include facet crawl tunnels with multiple steppers, rock climbing structures and climbing ladders. Schools build many climbing structures for students because they help children build confidence, improve their muscular strength and get better hand-eye coordination. The number of K-12 students hasn't increased much recently, so schools haven't boosted their investment in climbing, causing their revenue share to remain flat during the current period.

tier_2_suppliers: Playground & Park Equipment Manufacturing in the US
Office Supply Stores in the US
Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Government Funding for Primary and Secondary Education
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Government funding for primary and secondary education represents government budgets allocated for primary and secondary schools. Primary schools often have playgrounds on their campuses for students to use, while secondary schools mostly install benches or bike racks. As budgets increase, schools are more likely to purchase new equipment or renovate old playgrounds. Growth in government funding for primary and secondary education represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

Playground designers generate revenue through the design and planning of playground structures intended for backyards. As a result, an increase in private spending on home improvements causes demand for the industry's services to rise as families with children may install home playground equipment such as tree houses, jungle gyms or swing sets.

Playground equipment is most frequently used by school-aged children while at home or at school. As the number of K-12 students rises, higher school enrollment rates increase demand for new or updated playground equipment. Similarly, an increase in this age group will support demand for playground equipment intended for backyard use.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from Playground and Park Equipment Manufacturing
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Playground equipment manufacturers make tables, bike racks, trash receptacles, seats, benches, slides and swing sets. Since most playground and park manufacturers hire designers to offer an appealing product, a rise in demand from playground and park equipment manufacturers almost always increases revenue for this industry. Declines in demand from playground and park equipment manufacturing pose a potential threat to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region of the United States.
The Mid-Atlantic region of the United States.
The New England region of the United States.
The Plains region of the United States.
The Rocky Mountain region of the United States.
The Southeast region of the United States.
The Southwest region of the United States.

barriers_points.barrier_title: No licensing requirements and minimal start-up costs
barriers_points.barrier_description: No licenses are necessary, but receiving a certification from organizations like the National Program for Playground Safety can enhance credibility and marketability.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Market share concentration is low because of localization
concentration_points.concentration_description: Small playground designers have built a solid reputation within their specific community, making it difficult for larger players to gobble up more of the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: HIGH INTERNAL COMPETITION HINDERS PROFIT GROWTH
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Despite soaring demand and revenue, profit has held fairly steady over the past five years, as high internal competition caused by localization has led to designers undercutting each other.

Wages comprise nearly two-fifths of revenue, but the industry's excellent performance over the past few years has caused wages' revenue share to creep downward during the current period due to the pay structure.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent additions and concentration of innovation in the industry is low, suggesting slow and widespread new technology entry that limits disruptive threats. The spread of market segments also suggests limited new entry points.

Backyard playgrounds for wealthy households, sports/fitness equipment, and climbing structures in schools are discussed, with little indication of major technological changes impacting these segments.

volatility_points.volatility_title: General Playground Equipment is Used in Many Different Settings
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for general playground equipment used in schools, daycares and parks has increased recently, causing its revenue share to rise.

volatility_points.volatility_title: SHIFTS IN INTEREST RATES CREATE SOME VOLATILITY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Interest rate changes affect households' ability to invest in backyard playgrounds, creating some volatility in that segment's demand.

FAQs.question: What is the document about?
FAQs.answer: The document contains industry data in the form of a table with columns for year, revenue, IVA (industry value added), number of establishments, enterprises, employment, exports, imports, wages, and domestic demand for a certain industry over the years 2005 to 2016.
